pullRequest.title: Refactor out an AsyncRetrier to allow for better testing
pullRequest.bodyText: This is part of #4610 - figured it could be split off and made its own thing. Class that takes a supplier of listenable future and returns a future that retries it up to n times, with a delay between attempts.

commit.message: Refactor out an AsyncRetrier to allow for better testing

nodes.bodyText: This if statement feels a bit odd: it exits when the predicate is satisfied (which makes sense), but also when you run out of retries. However, running out of retries will return the result even though it doesn't satisfy the predicate - meaning the name of the method retryUntilSatisfied is a little misleading, as it can return a result when the predicate is not satisfied. I think this is a bit misleading.
